intro: Tovomita martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique tovomita, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface.
